qas.question: What did the 11pm broadcast of The National omit?
Which title is CBC's flagship newscast?
When did CBC discontinue its late-night broadcast of The National?
During hockey season, when does the late night news update occur?

answers.text: during the first intermission of the second game of the doubleheader on Hockey Night in Canada

plausible_answers.text: excluded the analysis and documentary segment

qas.question: Why did the CBC cancel the 11pm broadcast of The National?
When did the first episode of The National air?
During what television season did the CBC start broadcasting Hockey Night In Canada?

plausible_answers.text: first intermission of the second game of the doubleheader

qas.question: The CBC has found that newscasts should not take up more time than this event?

context: The CBC's flagship newscast, <a1_0>The National<a1_0/>, airs Sunday through Fridays at 10:00 p.m. EST and Saturdays at 6:00 p.m. EST. Until <a2_0><b5_0>October 2006<b5_0/><a2_0/>, CBC owned-and-operated stations aired a second broadcast of the program at 11:00 p.m.; this later broadcast included only the main news portion of the program, and <b4_0>excluded the <a0_0>analysis and documentary segment<b4_0/><a0_0/>. This second airing was later replaced with other programming, and as of the <b6_0>2012-13<b6_0/> television season, was replaced on CBC's major market stations by a half-hour late newscast. There is also a short news update, at most, on late Saturday evenings. During hockey season, this update is usually found <a3_0>during the <b7_0>first intermission of the second game of the doubleheader<b7_0/> on Hockey Night in Canada<a3_0/>.
